intro: Vincetoxicopsis, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf morning glory, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Convolvulaceae. These plants are characterized by their heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. Vincetoxicopsis species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They are typically herbaceous annuals or perennials, often growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The genus is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
